result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelo Deleon II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
FIRST 2 MONTHS:  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  LAST 6 MONTHS:  Same Huber privileges PLUS Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Random urine screens.  No positive results. No illegal drugs. Maintain absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without valid prescription. No contact with drug community.
Seek and maintain full time employment. Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done. Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. Huber privileges for work and treatment. To be used by agent for violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo Deleon II

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order, signed and filed.
The defendant's motion or request for additional release privileges is denied. Additional release privileges would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless, and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent. 
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for child care.

DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:   10-09-2014      Initials:  AAC

Defendant Angelo Deleon in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Paul Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 
days time served, FIRST 2 MONTHS:  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  LAST 6 MONTHS:  Same Huber privileges PLUS Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 15 months with the following conditions:
*Court imposed but STAYED 45 days in the HOC, Huber privileges for work and treatment, to be used by agent for violations.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Angelo Deleon in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  No motions filed.  Defense requests plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-31-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angelo Deleon in court with attorney Joel Mogregn for attorney John S Schiro.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angelo Deleon in court with attorney John S Schiro.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-22-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Angelo Deleon in court with attorney Lucas Kaster for John S. Schiro.  Step Nolten for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-03-2014 at 08:30 am.
